title: Sonny Rollins - Next Album (1972) [Jazz][mp3 320][h33t][schon55]
description:
Sonny Rollins - Next Album
Year: 1972 (Milestone)
Label: OJC (1987)
Total time: 43:04
Bitrate: 320 kbps

Sonny Rollins first album after ending his six-year retirement is a particularly strong effort.  The highpoint is a ten-minute version of "Skylark" that has a long unaccompanied section by the great tenor.  Other memorable selections include "The Everywhere Calypso" and "Playing in the Yard." Rollins plays soprano on "Poinciana" and is heard using electronics (George Cables' electric piano) for the first time but this music is not all that different from what he was playing prior to his retirement. ~ Scott Yanow, AMG

Personnel:
Sonny Rollins (Tenor and Soprano Saxophone) 
George Cables (Piano and Electric Piano) - 1-5 
Bob Cranshaw (Double Bass and Bass Guitar) 
David Lee (Drums) 
Jack DeJohnette (Drums) - 1,4 
Arthur Jenkins (Conga ) - 1,3 

Sonny Rollins - Next Album Tracks:
01  Playin' in the Yard (Sonny Rollins) 10:25 
02  Poinciana (Buddy Bernier/Nat Simon) 9:58 
03  The Everywhere Calypso (Sonny Rollins) 7:54 
04  Keep Hold of Yourself (Sonny Rollins) 4:30 
05  Skylark (Hoagy Carmichael/Johnny Mercer) 10:17
